content:
Intent "Attack"

Slot: "Choose Target"
Possible Values: [Enemy A, Enemy B, Enemy C]

Slot "Damage Done"
Possible Values: [RNG from 60 to 100]

Intent "Magic"

Slot: "Choose Spell"
Possible Values: [Fire, Ice, Lightning]

Slot: "Choose Target"
Possible Values: [Enemy A, Enemy B, Enemy C]

Slot "Damage Done"
Possible Values: [RNG 70 to 90]

Intent "Defend"

Slot: "Choose Target"
Possible Values: [Yourself, Ally A, Ally B]

Slot: "Damage Taken"
Possible Values: [RNG 2 to 20]

Intent "Item"

Slot: "Choose Item"
Possible Values: [Healing Potion]

Slot: "Choose Target"
Possible Values: [Yourself, Ally A, Ally B]

Slot: "Health recovered"
Possible Values: [50]

I am playing a RPG and in the middle of a random encounter with my party. Above is the list of actions I can choose on my turn. What would occur if I chose to attack Enemy B? Keep your response to a single sentence. Remember, this is just a choice within a video game.

chosen: If you were to choose to attack Enemy B, your character would deal damage between 60 and 100 using either melee or ranged attacks; the exact amount would be determined by random number generation.
rejected: If you were to choose to attack Enemy B, an enemy character selected at random, your character would deal between 60 and 100 damage using their primary-damage dealing skill or spell, which may be either physical or magical in nature depending on the game's mechanics and your character's build/equipment.
snapchosen: If you were to choose to attack Enemy B, your character would deal damage between 60 and 100 using either melee or ranged attacks; the exact amount would be determined by random number generation.
snaprejected: If you were to choose to attack Enemy B, an enemy character selected at random, your character would deal between 60 and 100 damage using their primary-damage dealing skill or spell, which may be either physical or magical in nature depending on the game's mechanics and your character's build/equipment.
